name: This Mortal Coil
description:
'''This Mortal Coil''' were a British [[Musical collective|music collective]] led by [[Ivo Watts-Russell]], founder of the British record label [[4AD]]. Although Watts-Russell and [[John Fryer (music)|John Fryer]] were the only two official members, the band's recorded output featured a large rotating cast of supporting artists, many of whom were otherwise associated with 4AD, including members of [[Cocteau Twins]], [[Cindytalk]], [[Dead Can Dance]], [[Breathless (band)|Breathless]], [[The Breeders]] and [[Belly (band)|Belly]].{{sfn|Ulrich|2022|p=123}}

The project is known for its [[Gothic rock|gothic]], [[dream pop]] and [[ethereal wave]] sound. Throughout their run, they released one [[extended play]] (EP), [[Sixteen Days / Gathering Dust|''Sixteen Days / Gathering Dust'']], and three studio albums: ''[[It'll End in Tears]]'' (1984), ''[[Filigree & Shadow]]'' (1986) and ''[[Blood (This Mortal Coil album)|Blood]]'' (1991). The former produced their modestly successful cover of [[Tim Buckley]]'s "[[Song to the Siren]]", which peaked at number 66 on the [[UK singles chart|UK Singles Chart]]. After the group broke up in 1991, former member Watts-Russell formed the similar group [[The Hope Blister]].
